metadata.description: Name of your cluster - Between 3 and 23 characters. Letters and numbers only
Remote desktop user password. Must be a strong password
Protection level. Three values are allowed - EncryptAndSign, Sign, None. It is best to keep the default of EncryptAndSign, unless you have a need not to
The store name where the cert will be deployed in the virtual machine
Resource Id of the key vault, is should be in the format of /subscriptions/<Sub ID>/resourceGroups/<Resource group name>/providers/Microsoft.KeyVault/vaults/<vault name>
Refers to the location URL in your key vault where the certificate was uploaded, it is should be in the format of https://<name of the vault>.vault.azure.net:443/secrets/<exact location>
Replication option for the VM image storage account
Replication option for the support log storage account
Unique name for your OMS Log Analytics Workspace
Specify the Azure Region for your OMS workspace
Endpoint for Service Fabric Reverse proxy
Azure Active Directory cluster application id
Azure Active Directory cluster client id

securityRules.name: allowSvcFabSMB
securityRules.comments: allow SMB traffic within the net, used by fabric to move packages around

securityRules.name: allowSvcFabCluser
securityRules.comments: allow ports within vnet that are used by the fabric to talk between nodes

securityRules.name: allowSvcFabEphemeral
securityRules.comments: allow fabric ephemeral ports within the vnet

securityRules.name: allowSvcFabPortal
securityRules.comments: allow port used to access the fabric cluster web portal

securityRules.name: allowSvcFabClient
securityRules.comments: allow port used by the fabric client (includes powershell)

securityRules.name: allowSvcFabApplication
securityRules.comments: allow fabric application ports within the vnet

securityRules.name: blockAll
securityRules.comments: block all traffic except what we've explicitly allowed

securityRules.name: allowVNetRDP
securityRules.comments: allow RDP within the net

securityRules.name: allowReverseProxy
securityRules.comments: allow reverse proxy traffic
